sentences.sentence: Russia's state-owned energy company Gazprom says it has stopped supplying gas to Latvia, accusing the Baltic country of violating conditions for gas withdrawal without giving any further details.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Moscow has already cut off gas supplies to Poland, Bulgaria, Finland, Netherlands and Denmark, countries which have refused to pay for gas in line with an order by President Vladimir Putin to open ruble accounts.

sentences.sentence: There have now been two confirmed deaths from monkeypox in Spain and so far they are thought to be the only fatalities from the virus in Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: According to the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, there are more than 21,000 cases worldwide, with many being on the African continent where the virus is now endemic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: In Europe, Spain has reported more than 4,000 cases and is administering 5,300 vaccines received from the joint EU vaccine purchase scheme.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: But health workers say they are not enough to cover the at-risk groups.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: London is getting ready for the final of the Women's Euro and this year is particularly special for its citizens as it's not only hosting the final but the national team is competing in it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: England will face Germany on Sunday evening at Wembley Stadium.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: And although England's overall record against Germany isn't great, English fans are behind the girls.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: I think the whole country's kind of come together and shown how excited they are.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The girls have proven, obviously, they deserve to be in the final.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And, yeah, I think we're just both quite excited to see if we can try and win now.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: With the stadium expected to be sold out, some fans also think that whatever the outcome, women's football is the big winner.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: We're playing Germany, so I'd like a 2-0.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: But any win will do, won't it?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: But just the fact that they've got this far, and now it just opens it for women's football, that it's going to be respected everywhere hopefully, so fingers crossed." The Lionesses have already had their most successful women's Euro campaign since 2009.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: They also go into the final unbeaten in 19 games under head coach Serena Wiegmann. Their last major final was in 2009 at the European Championships, when they also played Germany and lost 6-2.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The German side has won the title an impressive eight times, making it the most successful team in the competition's history.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: They were given a slim chance in pre-tournament rankings of reclaiming the title, but have nevertheless battled their way to the final.
